author: IGN
description:
Check out the playstyles spotlight trailer for Godbreakers, a third-person co-op hack-and-slash action game developed by To The Sky. In Godbreakers each archetype delivers it's own potential playstyle. Which style are you going to go for? 
Godbreakers is launching in 2025 for PlayStation 5 (PS5) and PC (Steam and Epic Games Store) with a demo available now on Steam.
title: Godbreakers - Official Playstyles Spotlight Trailer

author: IGN
description:
Meet Emi, Madoka, and Yoshie, part of the Denshattack! rebels as they outsmart rival crews, face wild bosses, and turn enemies into allies.
In a world where a climate catastrophe has rendered the rich untouchable via their air-purifying domes, the rest are left to survive in the undomed wastelands of a derelict Japan. Be part of the rebellious movement known as Denshattack and reclaim and rebuild the broken-down sections of the abandoned legacy railroad tracks. Denshattack! comes to Xbox and PC in Spring 2026.

#ign #gaming
title: Denshattack! - Official Meet The Crew Trailer

author: IGN
description:
Welcome to a special gamescom edition of Next-Gen Console Watch, our show following everything happening with the latest gaming hardware. I’m Daemon Hatfield and I’m joined by Max Scoville and Jada Griffin from Podcast Beyond. And there’s been a lot of news this week as it relates to this very show. We have the release date for the Xbox ROG Ally X handheld. It’s less than two months away but they haven’t revealed the price, yet. Not a good sign. There is apparently consensus among developers here at gamescom that they have to start making games faster. Music to my ears. But let’s start with some PlayStation news this week. PlayStation isn’t here at gamescom but it did have an announcement to make.

#IGN #Gaming #gamescom2025
title: Did Sony Just Nerf Its PS5 Lifetime Sales? - Next-Gen Console Watch | gamescom 2025

author: IGN
description:
What's the real Metal Gear Solid 3? Your mission, Jack, is to infiltrate the various versions of this 2004 masterpiece and explore its changes throughout the years, for better and for worse.

From the iconic Metal Gear Solid 3: Snake Eater, released on the PlayStation 2, to the updated Subsistence release featuring that all-important third-person camera system, as well as Snake Eater HD with its lack of Guy Savage and crispy high definition textures, to the bonkers Snake Eater 3D port for the Nintendo 3DS, and the upcoming MGS Delta: Snake Eater.

What are the differences between all versions of Metal Gear Solid 3: Snake Eater? And is there a better version to play compared to the rest? Time to find out!

#IGN #MetalGearSolidDelta #SnakeEater
title: Metal Gear Solid 3: The Complicated History of All 5 Versions Explained

author: IGN
description:
Welcome to a very special gamescom 2025 episode of NVC, live from beautiful Cologne, Germany. A city known for giving the world delicious beer, breathtaking views of the Dom Cathedral, and a guy named Peer Schneider. From Hollow Knight: Silksong, to Kirby Air Rider, to Elden Ring: Tarnished Edition, to Pokémon Legends: Z-A, join us as we breakdown Nintendo's massive presence at gamescom.

#IGN #Gaming #gamescom2025
title: We Played the Biggest Nintendo Games at gamescom - NVC 775 | gamescom 2025

author: IGN
description:
Yes, yes, yes. The IGN UK Podcast is back in video form for a gamescom 2025 special. Cardy, Matt, and Jesse are here to talk about the best games they've seen at this year's show, including LEGO Batman: Legacy of the Dark Knight, The Blood of Dawnwalker, Resident Evil Requiem, Hollow Knight: Silksong, The Expanse: Osiris Reborn, and PVKK. Oh, and, of course, a tiny bit of chocolate chat.

#gamescom2025
title: The IGN UK Podcast Back in Video For One Week Only! | gamescom 2025

author: IGN
description:
What do Garfield, Norse gods, origami paper, and a time-loop village have in common? Absolutely nothing, except they all somehow ended up in September 2025’s lineup of video game releases. From roguelites that want to crush your soul to cute octopus tower defense games, we’ve got an eclectic buffet of digital chaos to run through. Consider this your survival guide to a month where you might play Borderlands 4 one minute and Garfield Kart 2: All You Can Drift the next..

Revealed and celebrated around gamescom 2025, September is stacked with major releases across PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, PC, Nintendo Switch 2, and more. Highlights include Hell is Us, Borderlands 4, Silent Hill F, Final Fantasy Tactics: The Ivalice Chronicles, LEGO Voyagers, Slime Rancher 2, Frostpunk 2, and Alien Rogue Incursion Evolved Edition. Whether you’re into survival horror, open-world adventures, RPGs, kart racers, or indie gems, this month has something for every type of player. Stay tuned for all the b
title: The Biggest Game Releases of September 2025
